chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin L Butcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence the defendant may be serving.  Sentence is to commence immediately.  On January 28, 2016 the Court orders the sentence credit be removed.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
10:24 a.m.  Defendant in custoday and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will enter a plea.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1, with no repeater and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, strikes the repeater and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision - Consecutive to any sentence the defendant may be serving.

CONDITIONS:

-$1,000 fine plus court costs
-BDF - $42.50
-DL revocation - 36 months
-IID - 36 months
-AODA
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Sentence is to commence immediately.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAP programs.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from 04/20 and when defendant was sentenced.

Court adjourned at 10:39 a.m.
Fox Lake Correctional Institution - 11/23/2015 at 9:30 a.m. (Plea & Sentencing)
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-23-2015 10:00 am

10:14 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - needs to make contact with the Department of Corrections.  Court will set for plea & Sentencing on November 23, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 10:16 a.m.

11:40 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant was sentenced in Fond du lac County and is now at Dodge Correctional - a writ is needed.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on November 2, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-15-2015 11:00 am

11:57 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant is in custody in Fond du lac County jail.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 15, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:58 a.m.
Status hearing at 08-04-2015 11:00 am

2:24 P.M.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - still waiting on additional discovery.  Court sets for Status Hearing on August 4, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:25 p.m.
(Defendant's)

By Atty Barbara Privat
Status hearing at 06-16-2015 01:30 pm

1:02 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on June 16, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:05 p.m.
Preliminary hearing at 04-28-2015 01:00 pm

2:49 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on April 28, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:52 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:18 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $1,000.00 cash bond and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to return to court on April 20, 2015 at 2:45 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:22 p.m.
